oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of hyperketonemia on circadian patterns of blood metabolites and milk predicted constituents in dairy cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Seely, C. R.
Bach, K. D.
Barbano, D. M.
McArt, J. A. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: non-esterified fatty acids
NEFA
β-hydroxybutyrate
BHB
hyperketonemia
circadian patterns
plasma
milk metabolites
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Estimates of milk and blood constituents by Fourier-transform mid-infrared (FTIR) analysis of milk offer a promising tool to monitor energy deficit in dairy cows. We sought to explore: 1) diurnal changes in plasma non-esterified fatty acids (NEFA) and β-hydroxybutyrate (BHB) and FTIR estimates of milk BHB and milk predicted blood NEFA (pbNEFA); 2) correlation between plasma BHB and NEFA; and 3) effect of hyperketonemia (HYK) on circadian patterns of plasma and milk metabolites.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 359
